title: summarise_hai(): Summarising HAI data
text: hai_data_clean derived BHAI package’s German PPS 2011 data. Headline national estimates (cases, deaths, DALYs) provided separately hai_headlines context, sourced published study.

title: summarise_hai(): Summarising HAI data
text: ways compare extend visualisations HAI data, see next vignette: summarising-hai. Next vignette: Dive deeper grouping summarising results summarising-hai.

text: deeper dive summarising infection counts plotting, see companion vignette: summarising-hai. Next vignette: Learn summarise totals plotting summarising-hai.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jyovika Aswale. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zacher B, Haller S, Willrich N, Walter J, Abu Sin M, Cassini , Plachouras D, Suetens C, Behnke M, Gastmeier P, Wieler LH, Eckmanns T (2019). Application new methodology R package reveals high burden healthcare-associated infections (HAI) Germany compared average European Union/European Economic Area, 2011 2012. Euro Surveillance, 24(46):1900135. doi:10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135. Aswale, Jyovika (2025). haiInsight: Tools Interactive App Healthcare-Associated Infection Data. R package version 0.0.0.9000. Available : https://github.com/ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-jyovika
code: @Article{,   title = {Application of a new methodology and R package reveals a high burden of healthcare-associated infections (HAI) in Germany compared to the average in the European Union/European Economic Area, 2011 to 2012},   author = {Benedikt Zacher and Sebastian Haller and Niklas Willrich and Jan Walter and Muna Abu Sin and Alessandro Cassini and Diamantis Plachouras and Carl Suetens and Michael Behnke and Petra Gastmeier and Lothar H. Wieler and Tim Eckmanns},   journal = {Euro Surveillance},   year = {2019},   volume = {24},   number = {46},   pages = {1900135},   doi = {10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135}, } @Manual{,   title = {haiInsight: Tools and Interactive App for Healthcare-Associated Infection Data},   author = {Jyovika Aswale},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-jyovika}, }

title: Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infections in Europe
text: Tools interactive app explore healthcare-associated infection (HAI) data derived BHAI package. package developed part ETC5523: Communicating Data Monash University.

title: Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infections in Europe
text: can install development version GitHub: Load package:
code: # Install dependencies if needed install.packages(c("devtools", "shiny", "ggplot2", "dplyr", "bslib", "kableExtra"))  # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-jyovika") library(haiInsight)

title: Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infections in Europe
text: functions let quickly compare infection distributions across groups - built-styling optional proportional views.
code: # Load included data data("hai_data_clean")  # Summarise total cases by infection type summarise_hai(hai_data_clean, by = "Infection_Type")  # Visualise totals by age group plot_hai_totals(hai_data_clean, by = "Age_Group")

title: Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infections in Europe
text: opens interactive interface : Filter infection type sex View totals infection type, age group, sex Display plots summary tables clear, styled output

title: Cleaned Healthcare-Associated Infection Data (Germany, 2011) — hai_data_clean
text: tidy dataset showing infection counts infection type, age group, sex ECDC Point Prevalence Survey 2011 Germany.

title: Cleaned Healthcare-Associated Infection Data (Germany, 2011) — hai_data_clean
text: data frame 190 rows 4 variables: Age_Group Age band patients, e.g., [1;4], [25;34]. Sex Patient sex ("F" "M"). Count Number infection cases stratum. Infection_Type HAP, UTI, SSI, BSI, CDI.

title: Cleaned Healthcare-Associated Infection Data (Germany, 2011) — hai_data_clean
text: Data derived BHAI package: Zacher et al. (2019), Application new methodology R package reveals high burden healthcare-associated infections Germany compared EU/EEA, 2011–2012.

title: Headline HAI Estimates (Germany, 2011) — hai_headlines
text: dataset manually compiled package author based values reported Zacher et al. (2019): Application new methodology R package reveals high burden healthcare-associated infections Germany compared EU/EEA, 2011-2012.

title: Headline HAI Estimates (Germany, 2011) — hai_headlines
text: tibble 5 rows 4 variables: metric Indicator name (e.g. "Cases (Germany, 2011)"). value Numeric estimate reported paper. unit Measurement unit (e.g. "count", "per100k"). source Citation original study.

title: Headline HAI Estimates (Germany, 2011) — hai_headlines
text: Zacher et al. (2019), Euro Surveill. 24(46):1900135.

title: Headline HAI Estimates (Germany, 2011) — hai_headlines
text: derived raw data. Instead, summarises key published indicators (cases, deaths, DALYs) communication visualisation purposes within app.

title: Plot total HAI counts — plot_hai_totals
text: Creates bar chart total infections chosen variable.

title: Plot total HAI counts — plot_hai_totals
code: plot_hai_totals(data, by = "Infection_Type", show_prop = FALSE, pal = NULL)

title: Plot total HAI counts — plot_hai_totals
text: data Data frame like hai_data_clean One "Infection_Type", "Age_Group", "Sex"

title: Plot total HAI counts — plot_hai_totals
code: # data("hai_data_clean", package = "haiInsight") # plot_hai_totals(hai_data_clean, by = "Infection_Type") # plot_hai_totals(hai_data_clean, by = "Age_Group") # plot_hai_totals(hai_data_clean, by = "Sex")

what: Launch the haiInsight Shiny app — run_hai_app
title: Launch the haiInsight Shiny app — run_hai_app
text: Opens interactive explorer included package.

title: Launch the haiInsight Shiny app — run_hai_app
Summarise HAI cases — summarise_hai
text: Totals HAI counts chosen variable (e.g. infection type, age group, sex).

title: Summarise HAI cases — summarise_hai
code: summarise_hai(   data,   by = "Infection_Type",   as_kable = FALSE,   caption = "Summary of HAI cases by selected grouping variable." )

title: Summarise HAI cases — summarise_hai
text: data data frame like hai_data_clean (must include columns: Infection_Type, Age_Group, Sex, Count) column name group : one "Infection_Type", "Age_Group", "Sex". as_kable Logical. TRUE, returns formatted kable table (requires knitr kableExtra packages). caption Character. Caption table as_kable = TRUE.

title: Summarise HAI cases — summarise_hai
text: tibble columns {} Total.

title: Summarise HAI cases — summarise_hai
code: data("num_hai_patients_by_stratum", package = "BHAI") #> Warning: data set ‘num_hai_patients_by_stratum’ not found # summarise_hai(hai_data_clean, by = "Infection_Type")
